data.title: Thomas Mansfield Family Law & Divorce Solicitors – London City
data.meta_description: Family law solicitors specialising in divorce, separation, child arrangements & prenups. Protecting you & your family's interests. Call us on 020 3868 6345.
data.text:
About Thomas Mansfield Family Law

Our specialist family lawyers covering the City of London stand out from the crowd because they are personable, genuinely interested in their clients’ hopes and needs and professional in their approach. Taking the first step to call a family law solicitor is a big decision. Our solicitors are highly skilled family lawyers who deliver the best possible outcome for clients through clear, sensible and honest advice and a sensitive and caring approach.

Our expertise lies in the full service of family law matters. We advise on the division of matrimonial assets including the family home, second homes, cross jurisdictional assets such as holiday homes overseas, pensions and long-term incentive or investment schemes. We also advise clients on the division of businesses on divorce or separation and regularly advise clients with substantial matrimonial assets.

We have the expertise and resources to provide advice on complex disputes involving international parties and assets as well as the more straightforward divorce or separation issues.

In addition to divorce, we advise clients about children matters including contact arrangements any relocating children outside of England and Wales, domestic violence, prenuptial and cohabitation agreements, civil marriages and separation.

Based at Token House, Thomas Mansfield is located at the heart of the City of London, near the Bank of England and close to Bank Station.

Our clients

Our clients come from a diverse background from senior executives and those of high net worth of inherited wealth to those with average income and assets.

Marriage, Civil Partnerships and Cohabitation FAQs for LGBTQ+ Couples

Explore the key differences between marriage, civil partnerships and cohabitation. Get answers to common questions about legal protections and more for LGBTQ+ couples.

Connect over coffee with Thomas Mansfield Family Law

We are delighted to launch our connect over coffee networking mornings, from Thursday 11 April this year. The event is designed for family law and other professionals looking to build strong connections, exchange valuable insights, and explore referral opportunities in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere [...]

The changing face of relationships: a call for cohabitation law reform

Recent findings from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) reveal significant changes in the relationship patterns in England and Wales. With a noticeable decline in marriage rates among individuals aged over 16 and a concurrent rise in cohabitation, the report points to a substantial shift in societal norms and relationship dynamics.

https://www.tmfamilylaw.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/cohabitation-1.jpg 592 1920 Susi Gillespie https://www.tmfamilylaw.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/new-logo.png Susi Gillespie2024-03-01 14:43:432024-03-01 14:43:43The changing face of relationships: a call for cohabitation law reform
